name: Hanoi
description: Vietnam's capital city with rich history, French colonial architecture, and incredible street food scene
highlights: Old Quarter with narrow streets and traditional shop houses
Bia Hoi Corner - famous beer street

name: Ha Giang
description: Mountainous province with UNESCO Geopark, home to 17 ethnic groups and the famous Ha Giang Loop
highlights: Ha Giang Loop - 3 day motorbike tour
Dong Van Karst Plateau UNESCO Geopark

name: Cat Ba Island
description: Largest island in Lan Ha Bay, alternative to Ha Long Bay with fewer crowds
highlights: Hang Quan Hospital Cave (Vietnam War site)

name: Ninh Binh
description: Known as 'Halong Bay on Land' with limestone karsts, rice fields, and ancient temples
highlights: Bai Dinh Pagoda - largest Buddhist temple complex
Hang Mua Pagoda viewpoint (500 steps climb)

name: Hue
description: Former imperial capital with UNESCO World Heritage sites and royal cuisine
highlights: Dong Ba Market for Bun Bo Hue soup

name: Hoi An
description: UNESCO World Heritage ancient trading port famous for lanterns, tailors, and cuisine
highlights: Ancient Town with Japanese Covered Bridge
Basket boat tours in coconut forest
Night market along Thu Bon River
transportFromHue: 3.5-hour motorbike ride via Hai Van Pass

name: Da Nang
description: Modern coastal city with beaches, mountains, and gateway to Hoi An
highlights: Marble Mountains with caves and pagodas
Ba Na Hills with Golden Bridge

name: Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon)
description: Vietnam's largest city with French colonial architecture, vibrant nightlife, and diverse food scene
highlights: Notre-Dame Cathedral and Central Post Office
